instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very strange.

Client reports that it started to become vey slow in macos,  until it stoped working.

If If pressure the power button once, the fan spin1 turn and turns off. When trigerring <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, it has the same behavier.

However, if if keep pressuring the power button or trigering the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> for 2 or 3 seconds, the mac turns on and i have display (board alone on bench).

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Check how <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> reacts, disconnecting keyboard first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

It has the same behavier full assembled, w/o the keyboard connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Run corresponding ASD.

Battery is charging?
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> steady 3.3V (in normal mode)?

Check <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> outputs.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Battery is charging and  <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is 3.454V steady.

<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 2.8V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.424V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Run corresponding ASD; lets see if any error pops up.
Fan spins normally?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
HI,
ASD didn't found any problem, and FAN spins normaly, when it boots. When it doesn't boot, the FAN starts to spin imidiatly when power buttun is presured, and then stops.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and check all current/voltage sensors reported.
See if any value is strange.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I've instaled a new macOS, but i can't see nothing strange in HWMonitor.
Any idea?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Is the machine working good, or slow?
